newsitem.title: USA: Sallie Mae board candidate withdraws name.
newsitem.headline: Sallie Mae board candidate withdraws name.

text.p: Student Loan Marketing Association said Wednesday that a nominee for the board of directors of a proposed holding company had withdrawn his name from the slate.
It said William Simms withdrew his name from a list of 16 candidates to form the board for personal reasons.
On Thursday, shareholders are to vote on a proposal to create a holding company for the association in order to make it a state-chartered entity free of government ties.
The association, which provides financial services for postsecondary education needs, is a government-sponsored entreprise.
On May 9, a dissident group of shareholders failed to win enough votes for its own privatization plan.
